paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 variant c.1929delG, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 23 year old Caucasian female (proband), 50s Caucasian male (father)
patients.phenotype: recurrent undifferentiated sarcoma in proband; family history of various cancers

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here we present the case of a 23 year old Caucasian patient with recurrent undifferentiated sarcoma who had NGS-based tumor analysis...
Subsequently, the patient’s father was tested, revealing that he had the BRCA2 c.1929delG pathogenic mutation...

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 mutation is expected to lead to premature truncation of the Brca2 protein prior to the area of Rad51 binding and the DNA binding domain.

variants.segregation_data: The BRCA2 mutation segregates with disease in the family; confirmed in the father.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on familial segregation and clinical context.
variants.additional_notes: The proband's family history meets criteria for HBOCS, but the mutation was paternally inherited.
key_quotes: The report stated that the BRCA2 mutation is expected to lead to premature truncation of the Brca2 protein prior to the area of Rad51 binding and the DNA binding domain.
Subsequently, the patient’s father was tested, revealing that he had the BRCA2 c.1929delG pathogenic mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
